title: Global Learning and Societal Well-being
text: This is the first social platform developed around the fundamental values necessary to increase self-efficacy. The user-designed engagement is beneficial for those who seek positive influences to learn and expand their understanding of different cultures as well as personal growth. Their immediate response to requests for assistance is unprecedented compared to alternative social media platforms. While I am technologically challenged due to cognitive disabilities, I find this to be the best platform for ease of use and access and global reach. Kudos to TikTok for developing a means to increase global awareness and relationships among so many cultural dimensions. My only concern is privacy and lack of transparency in the government‚Äôs involvement in this platform. The manner in which user information is being collected raises privacy concerns. Additionally intellectual property rights/protection and plagiarism is not addressed anywhere. So while the platform is the most promising to unite and improve social wellness, it is unclear what users are giving up of their citizenship rights to receive the platform benefits. I would proceed with caution in engaging with this social platform.

title: 2020 Full of Sadness
text: I began 2020 uncertain of where I was headed. My dreams had come true in 2019 with a new home but, I was entering this new home alone. My Joshua had gone to Rainbow Bridge in 2015 and my loss had hit hard. I wanted my new beginning to be a healing but, it turned into more heartache, tears and loneliness. The 2020 Rona hit scared me to no end with elderly parents and my brother living with them and he may have heeded the mask wearing but, never stopped heading out to places where way too many chances of spreading the virus was possible. Going into May I began working from home which was, also, a dream come true yet, it hit me even harder. So as you can see...my life was sucking in my HEAD..Mentally I was a mess! Then came Tik Tok and I became addicted but, as it worked it‚Äôs magic I began to feel whole, again. I know I was working on myself as I listened to affirmations, laughter, with friendships developing and loneliness ending. I tried my hand at some videos and my confidence is growing again. I see 2021 as a new beginning. And I have my Tik Tok friends to thank ü•∞üíØ‚ú®And Tik Tok for being an outlet to releasing the negative and filling up my heart with the positivity.

title: Absolutely deplorable follow through on community guidelines
text:
Tik Tok has been selective about what content they take down when reported in a way that benefits white supremacy. Currently there is an account on their platform that is putting George Floyd's face on life sized dolls and doing a number of disturbing things with the dolls. From running the dolls over with a steam roller to having the doll thrust when audio is played that says his murderer's name. This account has been reported probably hundreds of times by various other accounts (mine included) and yet the result is that Tik Tok every single time so far has determined that that type of content "doesn't violate community guidelines."

In addition to this many creators and users of the app (myself included) have noticed that white creators are routinely allowed to use the n word (content doesn't get removed when reported) while Black creators have their content removed and even their accounts suspended when they stitch this content in attempt to raise awareness and ask the white creators to stop using harmful language. BIPOC creators also get their content removed and their accounts suspended for simply talking about the discrimination they face in their every day lives. 

This app needs to stop protecting white supremacists and denying BIPOC creators the ability to speak out against issues that directly harm them.

title: about tiktok
text:
has your child asked you to get tiktok?! 
Heres some things you should know before saying yes!
tiktok allows you to have a private or public account, public is when anybody on the app can see your videos, private is were everyone has to request to see the account or videos, if a child under the age of 13 asked to get the app, definitely make sure they make their acc private! How to do that is you go to your profile, press the three dots in the right corner of the screen, press privacy and tap the little switch next to the words‚Äùprivate acc‚Äù and there you go! I definitely recommend to make your child's account private, there are many adults on the app that may be a little to creepy. but over all the app is amazing for you child to learn new things and have a fun time! If you are thinking about getting the app yourself Over the age of 15 I definitely recommend it! Its a-lot of fun and you get to show your creativity by roleplays,coloring videos, edits, and really anything!!!! But tiktok is not the best place to share private information to random strangers on the app,So please stay safe while using the app!! but like i said its a great and fun app! I love it myself! Have a great day! God bless you all

title: TikTok For All and All For TikTok
text: TikTok used to be for the younger generation, but now there are people of all ages doing TikTok, and it is so awesome. There are funny videos, sad videos, informative videos, crazy videos, serious videos, and anything you could dream up videos. You never know what you are going to run across. I love it. It's the best media app I've run across, and there are a lot of them. Don't worry about going viral or earning money. title: Shadow banning is out of control
text: The number of creators I see talking about being shadowbanned despite breaking zero community guidelines is ridiculous. Not to mention! Most of these creators are people of color, queer, or both. The rest are allies. Anyone who speaks out in favor of the BLM movement frequently gets shot down by the apparently impartial company, despite others posting from the other side facing no consequences. It got to the point where the whole blacklivesmatter tag was blocked. They‚Äôve done this not only to the black community and allies but to any minority group, including but not limited to: indigenous peoples, Hispanic Americans, Asian Americans, the LGBT community, and the disabled community. It‚Äôs honestly disgusting that the company (and that‚Äôs what it is, a company. No decision is made by one good hearted person) claims to support these communities while simultaneously silencing them for the benefit of PR. I‚Äôm joining the Juneteenth walkout of this app, and I‚Äôm happy to do so. They need to understand that their users do have power over what happens to the app as a whole. We write their paycheck. If they want to keep saying whatever they think will calm their consumers while their actions reflect the opposite of their words, they can watch those consumers leave one by one. If they want to keep siding with the oppressor, they can face the consequences. We‚Äôre not stupid. We demand to be heard.

title: Unfair community guidelines
text: I absolutely love tik tok. I am so addicted and so are all of my friends. However, I feel that the video review process is a bit odd. Many videos contain curse words, but curse words are counted as a violation of community guidelines when used in captions or comments. Many people post videos of them drinking and will mention in the caption that they are of legal drinking age and that they do not recommend underage drinking, yet will be penalized for it (when many other videos are not). I once posted a video that was inspired by several other videos on the app, which contained short clips of each friend of mine drinking, and then passing the drink to the next person. My video was taken down due to a violation of community guidelines, so I submit an appeal mentioning how everyone in the video was 21. It got put back up but got barely any views, so I reposted it. It got taken down immediately and they did not accept my second appeal? It does not make sense and was not fair considering they accepted my first appeal. I can see that many other people have this problem and I just wonder why they are so strict when some of these videos that violate community guidelines are actually great (and extremely popular) content.

title: Stupid but addicting.

     First off, the lives. Only people over 1000 followers get to go live, which I think is ridiculous. Secondly,  you need to fix your issue where people randomly get suspended by their lives for getting reported. When someone is reporting you should make it a REQUIREMENT to have evidence and if they don‚Äôt have any, their complaint is invalid.  Thirdly, the age limit. It needs to be where people only up to 20-25 should be able to sign up, minus ‚Äúthebentist‚Äù and the other cool, family friendly tik-tokers that everyone loves.  I think this because girls and boys are constantly getting verbally harassed by older people on tiktok, such as the Budday.  They are being forced to do things they don‚Äôt want to or see graphic things. Or are tricked to give personal info such as their number, email, etc. These are just a few of my complaints. Honestly, this is my favorite app and I highly recommend! üíï There is an age restriction, 13+, but there is not really any inappropriate content , if I made the restriction, I would say 10+, but that‚Äôs your choice! I honestly don‚Äôt even sleep! You can heart videos, favorite them, share, comment, repost, etc. there is also a bunch of filters and effects you can use! There is an unlimited amount of songs and beats, you can even post your own content, and if people like your content, they will follow you! and after a certain amount of followers, you‚Äôll get verified with a blue check by your name. You ca. customize your profile and name, search for videos, or go LIVE. You can even make effects! A bunch of celebrities and companies are on this app, like Arianna Grande, Tom Holland, Bille Ellish, Bubble, Dulingo, Drumstick, you name it! You can even get paid for the videos you post! What doesn‚Äôt this app have? ü©µüõçÔ∏è

title: Two Star Review
text: I love this app. It makes me laugh, cry, and it just makes my day. I love sending videos to my friends through direct messaging. However, because of my age, I cannot do that anymore. I understand it is for the safety of younger users, but if you‚Äôre going to have a specific feature, have it be for all users. Another complaint I have is going live. Also, the (for loss of better words) ‚Äúrule‚Äù about how you must have a thousand followers to go live. There are small accounts that can‚Äôt go live for this reason. What harm will it do if you take that ‚Äúrule‚Äù off? Another thing, the one hundred character limit on comments has to go. I have replied to myself to finish a comment. I am a very opinionated person, and if I have something to say, I will say it, but most of the time it is hard due to this character quantity restriction. Another thing I have yet to be confirmed but is very believable is keeping people who aren‚Äôt of ideal beauty standards off of the For You page. That is very much messed up and should not be tolerated, and I would to see like more small accounts on the For You page. Thank you.

title: Issues with some of the content and reporting
text: It‚Äôs a good app overall, but I have some issues with it. I feel like they aren‚Äôt considerate of all of their users. Sometimes they take down videos from ‚Äúviolations‚Äù when they are fine, but then when I report a scam of ‚ÄúYou won a free IPhone just click the link in the description‚Äù they say the video has no violations. Maybe I reported it under the wrong violation, but that kind of content needs to be removed. Then I report a fishing bot and they still say there is no violation. This is so frustrating for users who are trying to help them keep the app clean of this kind of content. I probably have too many ‚Äúfalse‚Äù reports since now it takes only a couple of minutes to tell me of there was no violation on the ‚Äúclick the link and we can start chatting‚Äù video that a bit sent me. I understand that it is hard for them to go through all the reports that get submitted each day, but at this point I feel like they may not really care about what gets reported to them. I would send them a strongly worded letter, but what‚Äôs the point feels like they would just say ‚ÄòWe are sorry you feel that way, but just block them and ignore them if it bothers you so much.‚Äô

title: Deleted Facebook upon hearing they lobbied for the TikTok ban
text: I have learned more from rabbit hole research dives spurred from TikTok videos I‚Äôve seen, than I ever did in school. Very informative content, and the algorithm is good at helping you find community and connection. Information is shared quickly, often before it can be censored/shadow-banned. There are downsides: 1. Censorship of content related to human rights, while egregious and hateful content seems to get a pass. (No different than Facebook in that regard.) 2. Spam reporting is a bit of an issue. Even after blocking the user you disagreed with or whom was upset by you in some way, they can and will come in from anonymous other accounts they‚Äôve created to report you. 3. Not everyone can create playlists/folders, so for those that can‚Äôt, their videos end up in one long scrolling feed on their profile, like Instagram. BIPOC creators and those that post about human rights seem to get shadow-banned/spam reported, I‚Äôve heard many complaints of difficulty getting views, especially when speaking on topics around fascism, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia and privilege.

title: Review
text:
While I have been enjoying tiktok so much there are a few things I would change.  
 1. Notification and  Deleting PMs. While it is nice to get PMs I do not want to get a PM every time I become friends with someone. And if this is not going to change you need to add a delete multiple messages option. Such as being able to select more then 1 message at a time. I have over 10k messages that I can‚Äôt not sift through to find my friends messages so becomes a pain. 
2. BanningEtiquette. While I argee with banning someone for doing something wrong I do not believe someone should be band the instant someone reports them. I think that if a live is reported someone needs to sit in the live and actually see if any guidelines are being broken and then take action. I have a mark on my tiktok because someone Falsely reported me. I got my live back after 24 hours but that is still 24 hours I could not go live for something I did not do. 
  While I really do enjoy meeting new people and being live those 2 things are extremely frustrating.  I hope to keep seeing improvements in the future.

title: Ongoing issues with updates and no resolve.
text:
The only reasons why I‚Äôm giving this app 2 stars is because like many have said, it is a highly addicting app, there are a lot of bug issues that just keep getting worse with every update! 
First, started when I would go to my shared videos, I would take a minute or two to open the video up. 
Then, not only did that not change with the next update, but some videos wouldn‚Äôt play and I would have to exit out of the videos I was watching and click on the one I wanted and wait a minute to load. 
NOW, with this update, not only are these two issues STILL ongoing, but NOW I can‚Äôt even look at the comments on the videos on my fyp! It says that the user has disabled comments. However, when I go to their page and look up the video and wait a few seconds for the video to load AND another few seconds to comments load, that‚Äôs when I‚Äôm able to read them. 
I really love this app and have had it since late 2017, early 2018. But these issues just keep getting worse and soon I won‚Äôt be able to tolerate it any longer! I have an iPhone 12 Pro Max if it matters and I update my phone when there are new updates available. Same with this app. I never skip out on an update. But this is unacceptable.

title: Caption
text: I would like the caption on Tik Tok‚Äôs to not have no character limit and not just ‚ÄúTitle can‚Äôt exceed 100 characters‚Äù this really bothers me when I‚Äôm trying to explain something, but then having to take it to the comments while it can get lost in the comments and no one knowing the purpose. I would also like to not have a limit because maybe you are trying to explain something to your fans, but not having enough in the caption and also having to take it to the comments. I really think Tik Tok can improve on the caption even though it‚Äôs only used to write something very brief, I personally think it can be turned into something where you can write a whole paragraph and not having to take it anywhere else. For example you want to explain why you have been gone for awhile on Tik Tok so you write a whole paragraph and when you post it, it shows a little part of the paragraph to make it look like a caption, and says ‚Äúread more‚Äù in a bold font or is highlighted. title: Brainnumbing and Evil
text: I have had Tiktok since its conception in late August of 2018. I have seen every trend, every audio, every personalities rise and fall and then some. I went from daily and constant use, to having restrain myself to 10 videos at a time as to not lose myself in the app. But then they started editing the algorithm, catering to your interests and likes. This causes you to be completely consumed. It gives children, teenagers, and young adults a platform like never before, finding fame almost instantaneously if you understand how the app works and youre willing to sell your soul. My problem is not with how the app functions; it does its job perfectly. No, my problem is with the creators themselves. This is a Chinese app, there is an entire side of the app we cannot see we are not allowed to see and it begs the question what is on it? Thats also not my problem. Tiktok has demonstrated multiple times that it silences certain creators, and it is constant. Black people have been silenced. In light of recent events and the importance of awareness of the BLACK LIVES MATTER movement in the U.S. and now internationally, TikTok has deleted the hashtag #blacklivesmatter and related tags in an attempt to what I can assume is silence black voices and supporters. It is tiresome and disappointing and the app along with every police department in the U.S. deserves to burn.
